AAAS100.name: Race and Community in Local to Global Perspective
AAAS100.description: Multifaceted topics and dialogue on race. Race as an intractable and enduring feature of politics and society. Racial formations. Individual identities, collective action, and social structures. Ways that racial categories remain an organizing principle. Core focus on African American, African diaspora, and continental African sites of analysis.

AAAS300.name: Survey in Africana Studies
AAAS300.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
AAAS300.description: Core conceptual elements of Africana Studies discipline and peoples (African Americans, Africans and African Diasporas), including topics in race, identity, the Black condition, representational discourses, discrimination, oppression, resistance and alternative agency. Field trip required.

AAAS390.name: Special Topics in Black/Africana Studies
AAAS390.description: Special topics in African American, African, and African Diaspora studies. Topics are selected from sub-genres of Black/Africana Studies.
AAAS390.restrictions: Open to students in the African American and African Studies Specialization.

AAAS490.name: Independent Study in African American and African Studies
AAAS490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAAS490.description: Independent study in select and specialized topics in African American, African Diaspora and African Studies
AAAS490.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
AAAS490.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the African American History and Culture Specialization or in the African American and African Studies Minor.

AAAS495.name: Advanced Research in African American and African Studies
AAAS495.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of odd years
AAAS495.description: Advanced undergraduate research course in African American, African and African Diaspora Studies. Review of interdisciplinary topics that inform these Africana regions, including slavery, race, colonialism, civil and human rights, identity and discourse and political philosophies, including Black Nationalism African Centered paradigms, and Black Feminism. Participation in the University Undergraduate Research and Arts Forum. Field trip required.
AAAS495.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
AAAS495.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the African American History and Culture Specialization or in the African American and African Studies Minor.

AAAS890.name: Independent Study in African American and African Studies
AAAS890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAAS890.description: Faculty-supervised independent graduate study in African American and African Studies.

AAAS891.name: Special Topics in African American and African Studies
AAAS891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAAS891.description: Special topics in African American, African and African Diaspora Studies.

AAAS893A.name: Domestic Internship in African American and African Studies
AAAS893A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAAS893A.description: Internship with community based organizations, non-governmental organizations or educational and governmental institutions whose core entrepreneurial activity and mission is to work with African American, African or African descendant communities and policy issues. Facilitates the "communal component" of the discipline.
AAAS893A.prerequisite: AAAS 829 and AAAS 830 and AAAS 831 and AAAS 832

AAAS893C.name: International Internship in African American and African Studies
AAAS893C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAAS893C.description: Internship with international community based organizations, non-governmental organizations or educational and governmental institutions whose core entrepreneurial activity and mission is to work with African or African descendant communities and policy issues. Field trips required.

AAAS898.name: Master's Research
AAAS898.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAAS898.description: Directed research in support of Plan B master's program requirements.
AAAS898.prerequisite: AAAS 829 and AAAS 830 and AAAS 831 and AAAS 832 or approval of department
AAAS898.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the African American and African Studies major. Approval of department.

AAAS899.name: Master's Thesis Research
AAAS899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAAS899.prerequisite: AAAS 829 and AAAS 830 and AAAS 831 or approval of department
AAAS899.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the African American and African Studies major.

AAAS999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
AAAS999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AAAS999.prerequisite: AAAS 829 and AAAS 830 and AAAS 831 and AAAS 832
AAAS999.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the African American and African Studies Major.
